question: What organ appears abnormal in this radiograph? <image 1>
description:
The image is a radiograph (X-ray) of the abdominal region. The spine is visible running vertically down the center of the image. Surrounding the spine, various organs and structures can be seen. The stomach is located towards the upper left side of the image, appearing as a large, rounded structure. The liver is not distinctly visible in this particular view. The gallbladder is typically located near the liver but is not clearly identifiable in this image. The duodenum, part of the small intestine, is located to the right of the spine and appears as a curved structure.

Based on the description, the organ that appears abnormal in this radiograph is:

A. Stomach
